description: Former trademark of Celluloid Manufacturing Company

entries.meaning: Any of a variety of thermoplastics created from nitrocellulose and camphor, once used as photographic film.
examples: Then followed some experiments with drums, over which sheets of sensitized celluloid film were drawn, the edges being pressed into a narrow slot in the surface, similar in construction to the old tin-foil phonograph.

entries.meaning: (figuratively, often used attributively) The genre of cinema; film.
(obsolete) An item, such as a jacket, made from celluloid.
